intro: Peucedanum carvifolium-chabraei, commonly known as the Kashmiri cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of India and Pakistan. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in umbels. It is often found in moist, mountainous habitats and is valued for its medicinal properties. The roots and leaves are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
